Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit a three-run home run in his first-ever playoff game.
Five Dodgers relievers held the Padres scoreless over the final six innings in a 7-5 victory in Game 1.
Teoscar Hernandez hit a two-run single in the fourth inning, pushing the Dodgers in front.
Manny Machado hit a two-run home run in the first inning for the Padres.
Xander Bogaerts hit a two-run double in the third inning for the Padres.
Pre-Game Insights: Shohei Ohtani was asked if he were nervous before the playoffs began, and he offered a one-word answer in English: 'Nope.'

The Dodgers will send right-hander Jack Flaherty to the mound in Game 2. He was a combined 13-7 with a 3.17 ERA in 28 starts this season and 6-2 with a 3.58 ERA in 10 starts after he arrived in Los Angeles.
Former Dodgers right-hander Yu Darvish will take the mound for the Padres. Darvish was 7-3 with a 3.31 ERA in 16 regular-season starts.
Of particular interest will be Darvish's matchups against countryman Ohtani, whom he has held to one hit in five at-bats, with two strikeouts.
Post-Match Reflections: Shohei Ohtani said after Game 1 through interpreter Will Ireton: 'I've played at this stadium the entire year and was able to really feel the intensity of the stadium. I thought it was pretty exciting.'

Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said: 'I talked about this for a few weeks that we need to fight, and that's what we did. We didn't get off to an ideal start, but guys in the (bullpen) picked us up, and the offense was relentless.'
The Padres' Fernando Tatis Jr. said: 'They're coming alive, so we better outscore them. Find a way to make it happen no matter what and go from there.'
